Short Description:
bruÂ·tal  adj.  1)Savage; cruel; inhuman. 2)Harsh; ferocious.
Skyrim n. 1) Savage; cruel; inhuman. 2) Harsh; ferocious.
The two just fit together perfectly, don\'t they? And yet Skyrim is NOT brutal, at least not after a certain point in the game. Dovahkiin just simply becomes too strong, if you have a decent build. My mod aims to rebalance Skyrim so that it is a challenge both at low level and high. I have done this by preventing Dovahkiin from becoming demi-god like in his/her abilities. How have I done this? Read on!

Long Description:

1) Races, Actors & Player Character
2) Combat Mechanics
3) Magic
4) Perks
5) List of Game Settings Changes


[img]https://imageshack.us/scaled/large/837/logosectioncombat.png[/img]

COMBAT
1a - Mechanics
There have been many changes to how combat works.
Bleeding Damage: Now enemies bleed when struck with weapons. Bleeding stacks, and lasts 10 seconds per strike. Therefore, faster strikes means more bleeding, making Daggers much more formidable against flesh-and-blood targets.
Armor Running: Now running in armor will slow you down significantly. An approximation is that someone in Heavy Armor can sprint as fast as a person in clothing can jog. Light armor affects you as well, but not nearly as much as Heavy Armor
Armor Ratings: Armor ratings work different from Vanilla. Basically, 1 point of armor will reduce incoming damage by one point now, but Armor ratings display as much smaller numbers than vanilla Skyrim. 
Heavy Armor: The protection gap between light armor and heavy armor has been increased. This means Heavy Armor will protect you MUCH better than an equivalent tier light armor, but the tradeoff is it will slow you down.
Skill point value: Skill points are more important in deciding the overall damage your character can deal and withstand, than in vanilla.

1b - Weapons
-Melee Weapons
	Melee weapons had an unrealistic range in vanilla Skyrim. They were able to strike targets beyond their physical reach. I have lowered all these ranges to be realistic.
	Swords: -15% range
	War Axes: -20% range (seems harsh, but War Axes are short!)
	Maces: -15% range, -13% speed
	Daggers: -15% range
All Two Handeds: -12% range

-Ranged Weapons
Bow and Arrow combat is now significantly different than vanilla. I practice Archery in real life, so while I cannot exactly explain how all my changes add up to increased realism, you\'ll just have to take my word that Archery is now more realistic.
	Hunting Bow: 	Crt +1 (4), +18% spd (1.14), +5% stagger
	Long Bow: 	+4 dam (10), +1 wt (6), -25% spd (0.85), +35% stagger
	Imperial Bow: 	+2 dam (11), Crt +1 (5), -24% spd (0.75), +40% stagger
	Anc. Nord Bow: +2 dam (10),  -20% spd (0.7), +50% stagger
	Orcish Bow:	+1 dam (11), +20% stagger
	Dwarven Bow: +3 dam (15), -50% spd (0.38), +90% stagger
	Elven Bow:	-4 dam (9), +31% spd (0.9), +10% stagger
	Falmer Bow:	-2 dam (10), +25% stagger
	Forsworn Bow:	-5 dam (7), +43% spd (1.25),
	Glass Bow: No Changes
	Ebony Bow: +17% spd, +40% stagger
-Arrows
	Arrows have been tweaked as well.
	Iron: 		Renamed to \"Arrow\", -7 dam (1.0)
	Anc. Nord: 	-9 dam (1.0)
	Falmer:		-6 dam (1.0), no monetary value
	Steel Arrow: 	-9.75 dam (1.25)
	Orcish:		-9 dam (1.35)
	Forsworn:	-5.5 dam (1.5), no monetary value
	Elven:		-14 dam (2.0), +7 value
	Dwarven:	-10.5 dam (3.5), +4 value 
	Glass: 		-13.5 dam (4.5), +10 value, destroyed on contact (!)
	Nord Hero:	-19 dam (5.0)
	Ebony:		-15 dam (5.0), +20 value (due to extreme rarity)
	Daedric:	-14 dam (10.0), +42 value (due to extreme rarity)


[img]https://imageshack.us/scaled/large/577/logosectionraces.png[/img]

PLAYABLE RACES
Made default Health, Magicka, and Stamina for playable races = 50
Made default Carry Weight = 100
Remove health regeneration in combat.
Powers/Racial Abilities were unmodified unless otherwise mentioned.
Used a simple racial stats formula based on starting skill bonuses:
Argonian - 50h, 60m, 70s, 100cw
	+15 natural armor rating (due to having scales)

Breton - 50h, 80m, 55s 
	Better than average Magicka regen
	Starts with a weak Heal spell

Dark Elf - 50h, 75m, 60s
	Starts with Flames

High Elf - 50h, 85m, 50s
	Best Magicka regen
	Starts with Sparks & Fury

Imperial - 65h, 70m, 50s

Khajiit - 60h, 55m, 70s
	Worse than average Magicka regen
	Best Stamina regen

Nord - 75h, 50m, 60s
	Worst Magicka regen
	Has Berserk rather than Battle Cry
	Carry Weight +25

Orc - 80h, 55m, 50s
	Carry Weight +35
	Better than average Stamina regen
	Has Battle Cry rather than Berserk

Redguard - 70h, 55m, 55s
	Carry Weight +10

Wood Elf - 50h, 55m, 80s
	Carry Weight -10
	Combat Health regeneration while in nature (e.g. in the Tamriel worldspace)
	Can draw Long Bows & Hunting Bows 15% faster (stacks with the Perks)

Vampires
	Double health vs non-Vampires of the same race
	+100 Carry Weight vs non-Vampires of the same race
	Combat Health regeneration
